Name: Government Payroll
Description:
MPs who either hold [ministerial office](https://www.gov.uk/government/ministers), or officially appointed positions within the party.

They must toe the government and party line or face the sack due to the requirement to adhere to collective responsibility.
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: Official Opposition Payroll
Description: MPs who either hold [shadow ministerial office](https://www.gov.uk/government/ministers), or officially appointed positions within the party.
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: Cabinet
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: Front Bench
Description: MPs holding ministerial office or appointed to official party positions.
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: Shadow Cabinet
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: Shadow Front Bench
Description: MPs holding shadow ministerial office or appointed to official opposition party positions.
comment: See MPs_cached dataset for list of MPs in this group.

Name: StandUp4Brexit
Description: Campaign to ensure Brexit is delivered.

Name: BestForBritain
Description: Best For Britain is a civil society campaign to fight Brexit, launched on 26 April 2017

Name: GlobalBritain
Description: Pro Brexit, right wing think tank based in 55 Tufton Street. Home to a network of right wing think tanks including the UK climate denial group, the Global Warming Policy Foundation.

Name: LeaveMeansLeave
Description: Leave Means Leave is a cross-party political pressure group organisation that campaigns and lobbies for the United Kingdom to leave the European Union campaign for a hard, swift exit from the European Union. The campaign was co-founded by British property entrepreneur Richard Tice and business consultant John Longworth. The organisation grew out of the Vote Leave campaign during the 2016 EU referendum.

Name: European Research Group
Description:
Having existed for many years as a subscription-only research service, after the 2016 EU referendum, the European Research Group became the primary pro-Brexit group for backbench Conservative MPs, unified in pushing for the hardest possible exit from the EU.

In January 2019, led by Jacob Rees-Mogg, the ERG showed their number in parliament as never before, collectively defying the Tory whip to deliver the record defeat on the government's Brexit deal.

The ERG actually communicate through WhatsApp and the WhatsApp group includes MPs who do not regularly attend ERG meetings and whom dispute their actual membership.

There are two ERG members who are not Conservative party members: the Democratic Unionist party's Nigel Dodds and Sammy Wilson.

Name: Brexit Delivery Group
Description:
The Brexit Delivery Group, led by Simon Hart and Andrew Percy, a moderate group within the Conservative party, are a mix of Remain and Leave voting MPs who have accepted Brexit and now support a deal based exit from the EU.

The BDG hold regular meetings, rather than communicating via WhatsApp, like the ERG.

Name: Eurosceptics
Description: MPs who's stated views and voting record demonstrates they are strongly Euroskeptic.

Name: PeoplesVote
Description: Supporters of a second Brexit referendum.

Name: proEEA
Description: Explicit supporters of the UK remaining in the EEA.

Name: AntiEEA
Description: Explicitly against the UK remaining in the EEA.

Name: Support Second Referendum
Description: MPs explicitly in support of a second referendum.

Name: Against Second Referendum
Description: MPs explicitly against a second referendum.
